description: Blend of acupuncture +‎ pressure; surface analysis, acu- +‎ pressure.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) An alternative medicine technique, derived from acupuncture, in which physical pressure is applied to acupoints.
(countable) An act or instance of applying an acupressure technique.
examples: The warm needles of water acted like tiny acupressures on his face.

entries.meaning: (dated) A mode of arresting hemorrhage resulting from wounds or surgical operations, by passing under the divided vessel a needle, the ends of which are left exposed externally on the cutaneous surface.
